headline: SentinelOne raises annual revenue forecast on strong cybersecurity demand
summary: SentinelOne raised annual revenue forecast on Thursday, a sign of growing demand for the company's cybersecurity tools, sending its shares surging around 9% in extended trading. The company's artificial intelligence-powered Singularity platform ingests and analyzes security data in real time, automates threat detection and responses, and aims to reduce manual work for security teams. A wave of cyberattacks has hit global companies, including Microsoft, UnitedHealth Group, Walt Disney and Oracle, prompting the need for robust security solutions.

headline: AM Best Downgrades Credit Ratings of UnitedHealth Group Incorporated and Its Subsidiaries; Revises Outlooks to Stable
summary: OLDWICK, N.J., August 28, 2025--AM Best has downgraded the Long-Term Issuer Credit Ratings (Long-Term ICR) to "a-" (Excellent) from "a" (Excellent) and the Long and Short-Term Issue Credit Ratings (Long-Term IR; Short-Term IR) of UnitedHealth Group Incorporated (UnitedHealth Group) (Minnetonka, MN) [NYSE: UNH]. Concurrently AM Best has downgraded the Financial Strength Rating (FSR) to A (Excellent) from A+ (Superior) and the Long-Term ICRs to "a+" (Excellent) from "aa-" (Superior) of the health

headline: Does UnitedHealth Share Slide Create Opportunity After DOJ Probe Expands to Optum Rx?
summary: Deciding what to do with UnitedHealth Group stock right now is no small task. After all, the company has seen its share of drama lately, and the stock chart shows it. Maybe you have noticed the recent bump, with shares up 1.3% over the past week and gaining 7.7% in just the last month. However, if you take a step back, the bigger swings are hard to miss. The stock is still down nearly 40% year-to-date and has lost almost half its value over the past twelve months. If that sounds surprising...
